channel.title: Peoples on Gioele La Manno
channel.description: Recent content in Peoples on Gioele La Manno

item.title: Irina Khven
item.description: Short Bio I have recently completed my Masters at Moscow State University, Department of Bioengineering and Bioinformatics. During my undergraduate studies I’ve worked in a molecular biology lab and received a comprehensive training in many techniques. Both of my internships - in Weis lab at ETH Zurich and in Seigert lab at IST Austria - helped me realize that molecular neuroscience is the most exciting branch of modern biology to me.

item.title: Alex Lederer
item.description: Short Bio I am an incoming PhD student of the Computational and Quantitative Biology (EDCB) Program at EPFL. Originally from the United States, I completed my BSc in Molecular Biology and Computer Science at the University of Pittsburgh before working as a bioinformatician at EMBL Heidelberg. During my studies, I have been captivated by the rapidly-growing field of bioinformatics in light of the big data boom and ongoing advances in next-generation sequencing technologies.

item.title: Dimitri Lallement
item.description: Short Bio I am a final-year student in a Master of Computer Science and I am part of an exchange program at EPFL for a semester. I completed my bachelor in computer science at the Polytechnic Institute of Grenoble and for the last couple years I have been working part time for the French space agency: the CNES. I am a member of a machine learning project that aims to apply artificial intelligence concepts on business data.

item.title: Gioele La Manno
item.description: Bio I earned my PhD at Karolinska Instituet and I am proud alumnus of the Linnarsson Lab. My original training is in Biotechnology (BSc @UNIPA) and Biomedicine (MSc @KI) but nowadays I will probably turn around if somebody is calling out for a Molecular Biologist, Computational Biologist or Bioinformatician. My research focuses on understanding brain development. I am particularly interested in describing the sequence of states that embryonic stem cells go through during their differentiation towards mature neurons.

item.description: Master Students img.minion { border: 1px solid #ddd; /* Gray border */ border-radius: 4px; /* Rounded border */ padding: 5px; /* Some padding */ width: 175px; /* Set a small width */ } /* Add a hover effect (blue shadow) */ img.minion:hover { box-shadow: 0 0 2px 1px rgba(0, 140, 186, 0.5); } * { box-sizing: border-box; } /* Create two equal columns that floats next to each other */ .

item.title: Open Positions
item.description: Openings and available projects Postdoctoral researcher Read the full call in pdf here! The research project offered will be focused on developing new computational approaches to integrate single-cell/nuclei RNA-seq and ATAC-seq data generated from archival material. The successful candidate will develop new analysis approaches and apply them to a comprehensive human oligodendroglia dataset. The overarching goal is understanding gene regulation in the specification and maintenance of oligodendrocyte lineage in the human brain.
